snippet: Some see a political issue in a move to provide $6.4 billion in assistance to the unemployed, and Democrats were not optimistic that a deal could be reached.
abstract: Senate's unexpected vote to advance legislation extending expired unemployment benefits touches off delicate negotiations to secure final passage, even as Republicans and Democrats warily eye political motives behind efforts; some see political issue in move to provide $6.4 billion in assistance to unemployed, and Democrats are not optimistic that deal can be reached.
lead_paragraph: Some see a political issue in a move to provide $6.4 billion in assistance to the unemployed, and Democrats were not optimistic that a deal could be reached.

headline.main: Vote in Senate Starts Talks on Extending Unemployment Benefits
headline.print_headline: Vote in Senate Starts Talks on Extending Unemployment Benefits
